inference:
The semi-circles have centers K, O, and M. The distance OC = 32 and CB = 36.  Since OC and CB are parts of a straight line, the total length OB is 32 + 36 = 68.
The radius of the middle semi-circle is OC = 32, so the diameter is 64.
The radius of the large semi-circle is OB = 68, so the diameter is 136.
The radius of the small semi-circle is CB = 36, so the diameter is 72.
Area of large semi-circle = (1/2)π(68^2) = 2278.90
Area of middle semi-circle = (1/2)π(32^2) = 1607.68
Area of small semi-circle = (1/2)π(36^2) = 2035.75
Total area of the three semi-circles = 2278.90 + 1607.68 + 2035.75 = 5922.33
The shaded area is the difference between the area of the large semi-circle and the sum of the areas of the two smaller semi-circles.  
Area of shaded region = Area of large semi-circle - (Area of middle semi-circle + Area of small semi-circle)
= (1/2)π(68^2) - [(1/2)π(32^2) + (1/2)π(36^2)]
= (1/2)π(4624) - [(1/2)π(1024) + (1/2)π(1296)]
= 2312π - [512π + 648π]
= 2312π - 1160π
= 1152π
= 3619.1111...
Final Answer: $\boxed{3619.11}$

question:
The semi-circles have centers K, O, and M. The distance OC = 32 and CB = 36.  Since OC and CB are parts of a straight line, the total length OB is 32 + 36 = 68.
The radius of the middle semi-circle is OC = 32, so the diameter is 64.
The radius of the large semi-circle is OB = 68, so the diameter is 136.
The radius of the small semi-circle is CB = 36, so the diameter is 72.
Area of large semi-circle = (1/2)π(68^2) = 2278.90
Area of middle semi-circle = (1/2)π(32^2) = 1607.68
Area of small semi-circle = (1/2)π(36^2) = 2035.75
Total area of the three semi-circles = 2278.90 + 1607.68 + 2035.75 = 5922.33
The shaded area is the difference between the area of the large semi-circle and the sum of the areas of the two smaller semi-circles.  
Area of shaded region = Area of large semi-circle - (Area of middle semi-circle + Area of small semi-circle)
= (1/2)π(68^2) - [(1/2)π(32^2) + (1/2)π(36^2)]
= (1/2)π(4624) - [(1/2)π(1024) + (1/2)π(1296)]
= 2312π - [512π + 648π]
= 2312π - 1160π
= 1152π
= 3619.1111...
Final Answer: $\boxed{3619.11}$

inference:
The shaded area is the area of the large semi-circle minus the areas of the two smaller semi-circles.
Large semi-circle radius = 68/2 = 34
Middle semi-circle radius = 32/2 = 16
Small semi-circle radius = 36/2 = 18

Area of large semi-circle = (1/2)π(34^2) = 578π
Area of middle semi-circle = (1/2)π(16^2) = 128π
Area of small semi-circle = (1/2)π(18^2) = 162π

Shaded area = 578π - (128π + 162π) = 578π - 290π = 288π ≈ 904.78

Area of shaded region = (1/2)π(68^2) - [(1/2)π(32^2) + (1/2)π(36^2)]
= 2312π - (512π + 648π) = 2312π - 1160π = 1152π ≈ 3619.11

$\boxed{3619.11}$
